Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Synced preproc.y with gram.y. - Applied bug fix by John Summerfield.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove some dead code, simplify calling convention.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update some obsolete examples.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't assume free(NULL) is OK. Yes, I know ANSI C says it is.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix compile failure when --enable-multibyte. Marko Kreen

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch adding following functions: inet(text), cidr(text): convert a text value into inet/cidr set_masklen(inet): set masklen on the inet value Patch also contains regression checks for these functions. Alex Pilosov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for duplicate oids just introduced in patch. Don't think it needs initdb unless you are using inet types.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow a non-superuser database owner to vacuum all tables in his database, including system catalogs (but not the shared catalogs, since they don't really belong to his database). This is per recent mailing list discussion. Clean up some other code that also checks for database ownerness by introducing a test function is_dbadmin().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Docs for: > >> inet(text), cidr(text): convert a text value into inet/cidr > >> set_masklen(inet): set masklen on the inet value Alex Pilosov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: has_table_privilege functions from Joe Conway (with some kibitzing from Tom Lane). For the moment, only the OID/name variants are provided. I didn't force initdb, but the additions to the 'privileges' regress test won't pass until you do one.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix nulls in HTML file. Sergio Bruder

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove more NULL lines.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow remote query execution (dblink) Joe Conway

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revoke public read access from pg_statistic, create new system view pg_stats to provide controlled (and, hopefully, more readable) access to statistics. Comments on definition of pg_stats welcome. I didn't force initdb, but the rules regress test will fail until you do one.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing PG_SETMASK(&BlockSig) to SIGHUP_handler().

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Add bpchar to list of string types. Thanks to Steve McClure <smcclure@racemi.com> for the patch.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: fixed bug in connect.c

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Oops, forgot to commit doco updates for has_table_privilege.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: It turns out that the relcache thinks it can distinguish different rules and triggers by OID. So, even though we have no cross-references in the system catalogs to pg_rewrite.oid or pg_trigger.oid, we'd better have unique indexes on them. Put back pg_rewrite_oid_index, which I mistakenly removed a few days ago, and add pg_trigger_oid_index.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak startup sequence so that running out of PROC array slots is detected sooner in backend startup, and is treated as an expected error (it gives 'Sorry, too many clients already' now). This allows us not to have to enforce the MaxBackends limit exactly in the postmaster. Also, remove ProcRemove() and fold its functionality into ProcKill(). There's no good reason for a backend not to be responsible for removing its PROC entry, and there are lots of good reasons for the postmaster not to be touching shared-memory data structures.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make inet/cidr << and <<= operators indexable. From Alex Pilosov <alex@pilosoft.com>.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Keep the list of to-be-NOTIFYed names in a plain List palloc'd in TopTransactionContext, rather than using Dllist. This simplifies and speeds up the code, and eliminates a former risk of coredump when out of memory (since the old code didn't bother to check for malloc failure). It also moves us one step closer to retiring Dllist...

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Fix *escape* handling in copy_statement_with_parameters(was my fault).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Do some restructuring to improve performance of the catcaches. Teach CatalogCacheFlushRelation (formerly called SystemCacheRelationFlushed) how to distinguish tuples it should flush from those it needn'tSEMICOLON this means a relcache flush event now only removes the catcache entries it ought to, rather than zapping the caches completely as it used to. Testing with the regression tests indicates that this considerably improves the lifespan of catcache entries. Also, rearrange catcache data structures so that the limit on number of cached tuples applies globally across all the catcaches, rather than being per-catcache. It was a little silly to have the same size limit on both, say, pg_attribute caches and pg_am caches (there being only four possible rows in the latter...). Doing LRU removal across all the caches instead of locally in each one should reduce cache reload traffic in the more heavily used caches and improve the efficiency of cache memory use.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve wording of authentication files.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow removal of system-named pg_* temp tables. Rename temp file/dir as pgsql_tmp.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add GUC setting for Australian timezones. Uses new GUC boolean callback functions to clear date cache. Allow regression tests to pass when timezone set.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add new dblink to /contrib Makefile.'

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some references to USE_AUSTRALIAN_RULES that Bruce missedSEMICOLON plus a few trivial improvements in wording.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here's a small patch for dblink: - fixed dblink invalid pointer causing corrupt elog message - fixed dblink_tok improper handling of null results - fixed examples in README.dblink Joe Conway

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Untar copyright.html file and make good version.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch enables the contrib subtree to build cleanly under Cygwin with the possible exception of mSQL-interface. Since I don't have mSQL installed, I skipped this tool. Except for dealing with a missing getopt.h (oid2name) and HUGE (seg), the bulk of the patch uses the standard PostgreSQL approach to deal with Windows DLL issues. I tested the build aspect of this patch under Cygwin and Linux without any ill affects. Note that I did not actually attempt to test the code for functionality. The procedure to apply the patch is as follows: $ # save the attachment as /tmp/contrib.patch $ # change directory to the top of the PostgreSQL source tree $ patch -p0 </tmp/contrib.patch Jason

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Well, after persuading cvsup and cvs that it _is_ possible to have local modifiable repositories, I have a clean untrusted plperl patch to offer you :) Highlights: * There's one perl interpreter used for both trusted and untrusted procedures. I do think its unnecessary to keep two perl interpreters around. If someone can break out from trusted "Safe" perl mode, well, they can do what they want already. If someone disagrees, I can change this. * Opcode is not statically loaded anymore. Instead, we load Dynaloader, which then can grab Opcode (and anything else you can 'use') on its own. * Checked to work on FreeBSD 4.3 + perl 5.5.3 , OpenBSD 2.8 + perl5.6.1, RedHat 6.2 + perl 5.5.3 * Uses ExtUtils::Embed to find what options are necessary to link with perl shared libraries * createlang is also updated, it can create untrusted perl using 'plperlu' * Example script (assuming you have Mail::Sendmail installed): create function foo() returns text as ' use Mail::SendmailSEMICOLON %mail = ( To => q(you@yourname.com), From => q(me@here.com), Message => "This is a very short message" )SEMICOLON sendmail(%mail) or die $Mail::Sendmail::errorSEMICOLON return "OK. Log says:BACKSLASHn", $Mail::Sendmail::logSEMICOLON ' language 'plperlu'SEMICOLON Alex Pilosov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: RESET ALL secondary patch: Here is Tomified version of my 2 pending patches. Dropped the set_.._real change as it is not needed. Desc would be: * use GUC for settings from cmdline Marko Kreen

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Changed the error handling as follows. 1) ERRORs cause an SQL_ERROR and the SQLSTATE='S1000'. 2) NOTICEs cause an SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO and the succeeding SQLError() returns the NOTICE message.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Corrected the check for *message truncated* for the future use.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Bring RelationGetRelationName into sync with new temp rel names. Quick hack -- need to decide which header should include the other.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move temprel name define from temprel.h to rel.h.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up some longstanding problems in shared-cache invalidation. SI messages now include the relevant database OID, so that operations in one database do not cause useless cache flushes in backends attached to other databases. Declare SI messages properly using a union, to eliminate the former assumption that Oid is the same size as int or Index. Rewrite the nearly-unreadable code in inval.c, and document it better. Arrange for catcache flushes at end of command/transaction to happen before relcache flushes do --- this avoids loading a new tuple into the catcache while setting up new relcache entry, only to have it be flushed again immediately.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix badly broken RelationGetRelationName().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add IS UNKNOWN, IS NOT UNKNOWN boolean tests, fix the existing boolean tests to return the correct results per SQL9x when given NULL inputs. Reimplement these tests as well as IS [NOT] NULL to have their own expression node types, instead of depending on special functions. From Joe Conway, with a little help from Tom Lane.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out SET ALL patch because it is breaking things.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to deal with the ones that I missed the first time around. I tested this patch under Cygwin and Linux. Note that I only changed dblink's Makefile in the most minimal way to fix the link problem under Cygwin (i.e., use the link rule from Makefile.shlib instead). dblink's Makefile should probably be further patched to be consistent with the other PostgreSQL Makefiles. Jason Tishler

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Apparently, on some systems, ExtUtils::Embed and MakeMaker are slightly broken, and its impossible to make a shared library when compiling with both CCDLFLAGS and LDDLFAGS, you have to pick one or the other. Alex Pilosov

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Change the driver so that large error messages are returned by multiple SQLError calls.

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Add NUMERICOID to this script. This script can be run occasionally to make sure that we are using the right #defines in pgmodule.c but the OIDs are never actually expected to change.

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Make sure that everything says version 3.2.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Handle reading of startup packet and authentication exchange after forking a new postmaster child process. This should eliminate problems with authentication blocking (e.g., ident, SSL init) and also reduce problems with the accept queue filling up under heavy load. The option to send elog output to a different file per backend (postgres -o) has been disabled for now because the initialization would have to happen in a different order and it's not clear we want to keep this anyway.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Swedish translation for psql (my interpretation of Swedish, surely)

Document.author: petere
Document.document: There is no RTLD_GLOBAL on OpenBSD, says Alex Pilosov <alex@pilosoft.com>.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Re-add explicit declaration of filename_completion_function(), which seems to be missing in some header files (on OpenBSD 2.8?).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: -Bsymbolic requires -lc on NetBSD. Also add rpath for non-ELF. from Johnny C. Lam <lamj@stat.cmu.edu> via D'Arcy

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Shared libraries should not be linked explicitly against -lc on FreeBSD (see http://mail.gnu.org/pipermail/libtool/2000-July/001824.html). But apparently it should still be present with -Bsymbolic.

Document.document: Add support to lock manager for conditionally locking a lock (ie, return without waiting if we can't get the lock immediately). Not used yet, but will be needed for concurrent VACUUM.

Document.document: Mention that EXPLAIN results on small tables shouldn't be extrapolated to large tables. Recommend ANALYZE or VACUUM ANALYZE after populating a table.

Document.author: momjian

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here the latest version and first working release of Ora2Pg a tool to export Oracle database to PostgreSQL. It currently dump the database schema (tables, views, sequences, indexes, grants), with primary, unique and foreign keys into PostgreSQL syntax without editing the SQL code generated. You can dump only a particular schema from the Oracle database. Functions, procedures and triggers with SQL or PLSQL code generated must be reviewed to match the PostgreSQL syntax. Some usefull recommandation on porting Oracle to PostgreSQL can be found at http://techdocs.postgresql.org/ under the "Converting from other Databases to PostgreSQL" Oracle part. I just notice one thing more is that the trunc() function in Oracle is the same for number or date so be carefull when porting to PostgreSQL to use trunc() for number and date_trunc() for date. I will add more precision in type NUMBER conversion based on length to match as closest as possible all rich PostgreSQL numerics type. But it seems not to be urgent as it seems that Oracle DBAs only create number with length 22 (default) Space seems not to be their problem... Gilles DAROLD

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Marko Kreen <marko@l-t.ee> writes: > > secure_ctx changes too. it will be PGC_BACKEND after '-p'. > > Oh, okay, I missed that part. Cleared the ctx comment too - after -p it will be PGC_BACKEND in any case. Marko Kreen

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Optimizer can now estimate selectivity of IS NULL, IS NOT NULL, IS TRUE, etc, with some degree of verisimilitude. Split out selectivity support functions from builtins.h into a new header file selfuncs.h, so as to reduce the number of header files builtins.h must depend on. Fix a few missing inclusions exposed thereby. From Joe Conway, with some kibitzing from Tom Lane.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: National language support for pg_dump and pg_restore. Combined with big message clean up.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Install infrastructure for shared-memory free space map. Doesn't actually do anything yet, but it has the necessary connections to initialization and so forth. Make some gestures towards allowing number of blocks in a relation to be BlockNumber, ie, unsigned int, rather than signed int. (I doubt I got all the places that are sloppy about it, yet.) On the way, replace the hardwired NLOCKS_PER_XACT fudge factor with a GUC variable.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to thread item.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair logic error for multi-key indexes. From Oleg Bartunov.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous GUC variable references from commandline-GUC patch.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Turned high-frequently called pgstat functions into macros for speed. Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix longstanding error in VACUUM: sometimes would examine a buffer page after writing/unpinning it. An actual failure is unlikely, unless the system is tremendously short of buffers ... but a bug is a bug.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix longstanding error in VACUUM: sometimes would examine a buffer page after writing/unpinning it. An actual failure is unlikely, unless the system is tremendously short of buffers ... but a bug is a bug.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SimpleDateFormat performance improvement, thread-safe. Barry Lind

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add info on MATCH PARTIAL.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add replication email.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix VACUUM so that it can use pages as move targets even if they do not have any newly-dead tuples on them. This is a longstanding deficiency that prevents VACUUM from compacting a file as much as one would expect. Change requires fixing repair_frag to not assume that fraged_pages is a subset of vacuum_pages. Also make some further cleanups of places that assumed page numbers fit in int and tuple counts fit in uint32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Further work on connecting the free space map (which is still just a stub) into the rest of the system. Adopt a cleaner approach to preventing deadlock in concurrent heap_updates: allow RelationGetBufferForTuple to select any page of the rel, and put the onus on it to lock both buffers in a consistent order. Remove no-longer-needed isExtend hack from API of ReleaseAndReadBuffer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: gcc did not like new pg_stat macros, for good and sufficient reason. Add 'do { ... } while (0)' decoration to eliminate compiler warnings.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: NLS for the psql BACKSLASHd family of commands. (E.g., the column headers will have localized strings.) Also, modernize the system catalog queries where appropriate, e.g., with outer joins.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: portability enhancements

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: The System V resources discussed here apply to NetBSD as well. In fact I just finished changing the GENERIC files and the options(4) man page on NetBSD to make this clearer.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add missing dependency and fix thinko.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: fix markup

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Allow default transaction isolation level (a.k.a. set session characteristics) to be set through GUC.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Under new theory of operation wherein postmaster forks children immediately, we will fork a child even if the database state does not permit connections to be accepted (eg, we are in recovery mode). The child process will correctly reject the connection and exit as soon as it's finished collecting the connection request message. However, this means that reaper() must be prepared to see child process exit signals even while it's waiting for startup or shutdown process to finish. As was, a connection request arriving during a database recovery or shutdown would cause postmaster abort.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make the found-a-buffer-when-we-were-expecting-to-extend-the-rel path actually work. It had been throwing an Assert as of my recent changes to bufmgr.c, but was not really right even before that AFAICT.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update abstime expected results to match post-30-June-2001 reality. Probably the right fix is to remove 'current' special value entirely, but I don't want to see regression test failures until that happens.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In any case, it seems the REL7_1 branch needs the update too...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First non-stub implementation of shared free space map. It's not super useful as yet, since its primary source of information is (full) VACUUM, which makes a concerted effort to get rid of free space before telling the map about it ... next stop is concurrent VACUUM ...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Correct substring() example, found by Thomas T. Thai.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't go into infinite loop if /home/postgres/testversion/data directory is not writable.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Start the stats collector at a less randomly chosen time. Bad idea to start it before we have acquired the data directory lockSEMICOLON also a bad idea to start it before we have set up to catch SIGCHLD signals.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a little more error checking and reporting to readDatum().

Document.author: petere
Document.document: More message munging and localization for pg_dump, especially the --verbose messages, which had not been considered so far. Output to the terminal should okay nowSEMICOLON comments written into the dump are still English only, which may or may not be the desirable thing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to remove the ConnectionHook functionality and thus the JDK 1.3 dependency. For a further explanation see my posting to the JDBC list on Friday, explaining why this is being done. Barry Lind

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch moves the setting of the timezone on the SimpleDateFormat object inside the initialization section instead of doing it everytime the setTimestamp method is called. Thanks to Dave Harkness for this suggestion. Barry Lind

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch removes some old and dead code (and some related misleading comments) from the PG_Stream class. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove ConnectionHook.java. No longer used, bad code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prohibit a column from appearing twice in a PRIMARY KEY or UNIQUE constraint. This case (a) is useless, (b) violates SQL92, and (c) is certain to cause a failure downstream when we try to create an index with duplicated column names. So give an appropriate error message instead of letting the index failure occur. Per report from Colin Strickland. NOTE: currently, CREATE INDEX fooi ON foo(f1,f1) still fails with 'cannot insert duplicate key' error. Should we change that too? What about functional indexes?

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Check for jakarta-ant before ant, in case 'ant' is the screen saver program. Then, run a small reality test with $ANT to see whether it works.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Added GUC configuration options to control access statistics. Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't assume that max offset number stays fixed on a page when we're not holding a pin on the page. Use double instead of long to count rows in relation, so that code still works for > LONG_MAX rows in rel.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix typo. createdb -t --> createdb -T

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix typo. createdb -t --> createdb -T

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Fix my old fault(returns auto variable reference).

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Fire rule actions ON INSERT after original statement (if not INSTEAD). Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Repair libpq to follow protocol by not sending Terminate messages before the startup exchange is complete. Also make sure that packets defined as single bytes aren't sent with a trailing 'BACKSLASH0'.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Terminate message doesn't have a trailing zero byte.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Use CONNECTION_OK to determine whether startup phase is complete.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement LockBufferForCleanup(), which will allow concurrent VACUUM to wait until it's safe to remove tuples and compact free space in a shared buffer page. Miscellaneous small code cleanups in bufmgr, too.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Resolve a number of oddities in the Java build. First, remove the weird redirections between the build files, which didn't work completely. Now you just go to the directory of your choice and run make. Clean up the build files to have a logical order, fix the unnecessary rebuilds, prevent the deleting targets from removing files they're not responsible for. Ant 1.3 does not have a bug. It deletes directories just fine if you follow the documentation.

Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Sync with jdbc2, remove gratuitous white space differences.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Bring DatabaseMetaData feature tests up to date: * NULLs are sorted differently in 7.2 * table correlation names are supported * GROUP BY, ORDER BY unrelated is supported since 6.4 * ESCAPE/LIKE only supported since 7.1 * outer joins only since 7.1 * preferred term for procedure is "function" * preferred term for catalog is "database" * supports SELECT for UPDATE since 6.5 * supports subqueries * supports UNIONSEMICOLON supports UNION ALL since 7.1 * update some of the max lengths to match reality * rearrange some functions to match the order in the spec for easier maintenance

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Implement DatabaseMetaData.getCatalogs()

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE lock mode, coming soon to a VACUUM near you. Name chosen per pghackers discussion around 6/22/01.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix rule rewriter so that new ordering of ON INSERT actions applies in cases of qualified rules as well as unqualified ones. Tweak rules test to avoid cluttering output with dummy SELECT results. Update documentation to match code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessarily enthusiastic parenthesizing in reverse-listing of IS NULL, IS TRUE, and friends (my fault...)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure macros are adequately parenthesized.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove formatter's assumption that year would never exceed four digits. Enforce MAXTZLEN for all datestyles, not just some. Remove macro definitions that were redundant with datetime.h.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Support fake root install, separate build dir, dependency tracking, our choice of compiler and flags, uninstall, and peculiar Python installation layouts for PyGreSql. Also install into site-packages now, as officially recommended. And pgdb.py is also installed now, used to be forgotten.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Changes from Vince Vielhaber to allow the optional clauses of CREATE USER and ALTER USER to appear in any order, not only the fixed order they used to be required to appear in. Also, some changes from Tom Lane to create a FULL option for VACUUMSEMICOLON it doesn't do anything yet, but I needed to change many of the same files to make that happen, so now seemed like a good time.

Document.document: Remove mention that PREPARE is not implemented.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix duplication of -D during pg_ctl restart, from Peter E's patch.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move export PGDATA to the proper place. Quote some variable substitutions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The SQL preprocessor ecpg generates "initially deferrable" from INITIALLY DEFERRED in source code. cf. preproc.y:1455. Unknown.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove direct calls of index_insert(), instead use ExecInsertIndexTuples(). This makes VACUUM work properly with partial indexes, and avoids memory leakage with functional indexes. Also, suppress complaint about fewer index tuples than heap tuples when the index is a partial index. From Martijn van Oosterhout.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I updated the patch to use the SET AUTHORIZATION { INVOKER| DEFINER } terminology. Also, the function owner is now determined and saved at compile time (no gotchas here, right?)/ Mark Volpe

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Instead of believing SOMAXCONN from the system header files (which is a lie on many Unixen), invoke listen() with MIN(MaxBackends*2, 10000). The clamp value 10000 is configurable in config.h.in, if that proves to be necessary --- hopefully it won't.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak error message.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Well, after persuading cvsup and cvs that it _is_ possible to have local modifiable repositories, I have a clean untrusted plperl patch to offer you :) Highlights: * There's one perl interpreter used for both trusted and untrusted procedures. I do think its unnecessary to keep two perl interpreters around. If someone can break out from trusted "Safe" perl mode, well, they can do what they want already. If someone disagrees, I can change this. * Opcode is not statically loaded anymore. Instead, we load Dynaloader, which then can grab Opcode (and anything else you can 'use') on its own. * Checked to work on FreeBSD 4.3 + perl 5.5.3 , OpenBSD 2.8 + perl5.6.1, RedHat 6.2 + perl 5.5.3 * Uses ExtUtils::Embed to find what options are necessary to link with perl shared libraries * createlang is also updated, it can create untrusted perl using 'plperlu' * Example script (assuming you have Mail::Sendmail installed): create function foo() returns text as ' use Mail::SendmailSEMICOLON %mail = ( To => q(you@yourname.com), From => q(me@here.com), Message => "This is a very short message" )SEMICOLON sendmail(%mail) or die $Mail::Sendmail::errorSEMICOLON return "OK. Log says:BACKSLASHn", $Mail::Sendmail::logSEMICOLON ' language 'plperlu'SEMICOLON Alex Pilosov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: has_table_privilege functions from Joe Conway (with some kibitzing from Tom Lane). For the moment, only the OID/name variants are provided. I didn't force initdb, but the additions to the 'privileges' regress test won't pass until you do one.

Document.document: Update abstime expected results to match post-30-June-2001 reality. Probably the right fix is to remove 'current' special value entirely, but I don't want to see regression test failures until that happens.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here the latest version and first working release of Ora2Pg a tool to export Oracle database to PostgreSQL. It currently dump the database schema (tables, views, sequences, indexes, grants), with primary, unique and foreign keys into PostgreSQL syntax without editing the SQL code generated. You can dump only a particular schema from the Oracle database. Functions, procedures and triggers with SQL or PLSQL code generated must be reviewed to match the PostgreSQL syntax. Some usefull recommandation on porting Oracle to PostgreSQL can be found at http://techdocs.postgresql.org/ under the "Converting from other Databases to PostgreSQL" Oracle part. I just notice one thing more is that the trunc() function in Oracle is the same for number or date so be carefull when porting to PostgreSQL to use trunc() for number and date_trunc() for date. I will add more precision in type NUMBER conversion based on length to match as closest as possible all rich PostgreSQL numerics type. But it seems not to be urgent as it seems that Oracle DBAs only create number with length 22 (default) Space seems not to be their problem... Gilles DAROLD

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Mention that EXPLAIN results on small tables shouldn't be extrapolated to large tables. Recommend ANALYZE or VACUUM ANALYZE after populating a table.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't assume free(NULL) is OK. Yes, I know ANSI C says it is.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Install infrastructure for shared-memory free space map. Doesn't actually do anything yet, but it has the necessary connections to initialization and so forth. Make some gestures towards allowing number of blocks in a relation to be BlockNumber, ie, unsigned int, rather than signed int. (I doubt I got all the places that are sloppy about it, yet.) On the way, replace the hardwired NLOCKS_PER_XACT fudge factor with a GUC variable.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: High memory usage Here is a patch which inspired by Michael Stephens that should work Dave Cramer

Document.document: Add TEMPORARY sequences and have SERIAL on a temp table have a temporary sequence.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: RESET ALL secondary patch: Here is Tomified version of my 2 pending patches. Dropped the set_.._real change as it is not needed. Desc would be: * use GUC for settings from cmdline Marko Kreen

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some references to USE_AUSTRALIAN_RULES that Bruce missedSEMICOLON plus a few trivial improvements in wording.

Document.document: fixed bug in connect.c

Document.document: Fix compile failure when --enable-multibyte. Marko Kreen

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More comment out of block quote.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix rule rewriter so that new ordering of ON INSERT actions applies in cases of qualified rules as well as unqualified ones. Tweak rules test to avoid cluttering output with dummy SELECT results. Update documentation to match code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Start the stats collector at a less randomly chosen time. Bad idea to start it before we have acquired the data directory lockSEMICOLON also a bad idea to start it before we have set up to catch SIGCHLD signals.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Swedish translation for psql (my interpretation of Swedish, surely)

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch enables the contrib subtree to build cleanly under Cygwin with the possible exception of mSQL-interface. Since I don't have mSQL installed, I skipped this tool. Except for dealing with a missing getopt.h (oid2name) and HUGE (seg), the bulk of the patch uses the standard PostgreSQL approach to deal with Windows DLL issues. I tested the build aspect of this patch under Cygwin and Linux without any ill affects. Note that I did not actually attempt to test the code for functionality. The procedure to apply the patch is as follows: $ # save the attachment as /tmp/contrib.patch $ # change directory to the top of the PostgreSQL source tree $ patch -p0 </tmp/contrib.patch Jason

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Docs for: > >> inet(text), cidr(text): convert a text value into inet/cidr > >> set_masklen(inet): set masklen on the inet value Alex Pilosov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch adding following functions: inet(text), cidr(text): convert a text value into inet/cidr set_masklen(inet): set masklen on the inet value Patch also contains regression checks for these functions. Alex Pilosov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Libpq++ fixes for Win32 compile. Christian Ullrich

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Document meaning of lossy column.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: NLS for the psql BACKSLASHd family of commands. (E.g., the column headers will have localized strings.) Also, modernize the system catalog queries where appropriate, e.g., with outer joins.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Turned high-frequently called pgstat functions into macros for speed. Jan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix strangely formatted comment.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Apparently, on some systems, ExtUtils::Embed and MakeMaker are slightly broken, and its impossible to make a shared library when compiling with both CCDLFLAGS and LDDLFAGS, you have to pick one or the other. Alex Pilosov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for duplicate oids just introduced in patch. Don't think it needs initdb unless you are using inet types.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Disable COPY TO/FROM on views.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I updated the patch to use the SET AUTHORIZATION { INVOKER| DEFINER } terminology. Also, the function owner is now determined and saved at compile time (no gotchas here, right?)/ Mark Volpe

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This patch moves the setting of the timezone on the SimpleDateFormat object inside the initialization section instead of doing it everytime the setTimestamp method is called. Thanks to Dave Harkness for this suggestion. Barry Lind

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Include catalog/pg_type.h instead of manually extracting the interesting oid values.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Bring RelationGetRelationName into sync with new temp rel names. Quick hack -- need to decide which header should include the other.

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Add bpchar to list of string types. Thanks to Steve McClure <smcclure@racemi.com> for the patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Allow a non-superuser database owner to vacuum all tables in his database, including system catalogs (but not the shared catalogs, since they don't really belong to his database). This is per recent mailing list discussion. Clean up some other code that also checks for database ownerness by introducing a test function is_dbadmin().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The SQL preprocessor ecpg generates "initially deferrable" from INITIALLY DEFERRED in source code. cf. preproc.y:1455. Unknown.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Terminate message doesn't have a trailing zero byte.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix VACUUM so that it can use pages as move targets even if they do not have any newly-dead tuples on them. This is a longstanding deficiency that prevents VACUUM from compacting a file as much as one would expect. Change requires fixing repair_frag to not assume that fraged_pages is a subset of vacuum_pages. Also make some further cleanups of places that assumed page numbers fit in int and tuple counts fit in uint32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SimpleDateFormat performance improvement, thread-safe. Barry Lind

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress gcc warning.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is documentation describing plperlu differences from plperl. Alex Pilosov

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: The new files for statistical system views. Jan

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Change the driver so that large error messages are returned by multiple SQLError calls.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Changed the error handling as follows. 1) ERRORs cause an SQL_ERROR and the SQLSTATE='S1000'. 2) NOTICEs cause an SQL_SUCCESS_WITH_INFO and the succeeding SQLError() returns the NOTICE message.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix nulls in HTML file. Sergio Bruder

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Fire rule actions ON INSERT after original statement (if not INSTEAD). Jan

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Fix my old fault(returns auto variable reference).

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: The System V resources discussed here apply to NetBSD as well. In fact I just finished changing the GENERIC files and the options(4) man page on NetBSD to make this clearer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to thread item.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add new dblink to /contrib Makefile.'

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Do some restructuring to improve performance of the catcaches. Teach CatalogCacheFlushRelation (formerly called SystemCacheRelationFlushed) how to distinguish tuples it should flush from those it needn'tSEMICOLON this means a relcache flush event now only removes the catcache entries it ought to, rather than zapping the caches completely as it used to. Testing with the regression tests indicates that this considerably improves the lifespan of catcache entries. Also, rearrange catcache data structures so that the limit on number of cached tuples applies globally across all the catcaches, rather than being per-catcache. It was a little silly to have the same size limit on both, say, pg_attribute caches and pg_am caches (there being only four possible rows in the latter...). Doing LRU removal across all the caches instead of locally in each one should reduce cache reload traffic in the more heavily used caches and improve the efficiency of cache memory use.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Fix *escape* handling in copy_statement_with_parameters(was my fault).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revoke public read access from pg_statistic, create new system view pg_stats to provide controlled (and, hopefully, more readable) access to statistics. Comments on definition of pg_stats welcome. I didn't force initdb, but the rules regress test will fail until you do one.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove more NULL lines.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Resolve a number of oddities in the Java build. First, remove the weird redirections between the build files, which didn't work completely. Now you just go to the directory of your choice and run make. Clean up the build files to have a logical order, fix the unnecessary rebuilds, prevent the deleting targets from removing files they're not responsible for. Ant 1.3 does not have a bug. It deletes directories just fine if you follow the documentation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prohibit a column from appearing twice in a PRIMARY KEY or UNIQUE constraint. This case (a) is useless, (b) violates SQL92, and (c) is certain to cause a failure downstream when we try to create an index with duplicated column names. So give an appropriate error message instead of letting the index failure occur. Per report from Colin Strickland. NOTE: currently, CREATE INDEX fooi ON foo(f1,f1) still fails with 'cannot insert duplicate key' error. Should we change that too? What about functional indexes?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Correct substring() example, found by Thomas T. Thai.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Statistical system views (yet without the config stuff, but it's hard to keep such massive changes in sync with the tree so I need to get it in and work from there now). Jan

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Add NUMERICOID to this script. This script can be run occasionally to make sure that we are using the right #defines in pgmodule.c but the OIDs are never actually expected to change.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix badly broken RelationGetRelationName().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Untar copyright.html file and make good version.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow remote query execution (dblink) Joe Conway

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Check for jakarta-ant before ant, in case 'ant' is the screen saver program. Then, run a small reality test with $ANT to see whether it works.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Allow default transaction isolation level (a.k.a. set session characteristics) to be set through GUC.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix longstanding error in VACUUM: sometimes would examine a buffer page after writing/unpinning it. An actual failure is unlikely, unless the system is tremendously short of buffers ... but a bug is a bug.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix longstanding error in VACUUM: sometimes would examine a buffer page after writing/unpinning it. An actual failure is unlikely, unless the system is tremendously short of buffers ... but a bug is a bug.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: updates for new startup sequence, some reformatting

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Change SQLPrimaryKeys() so that it detects the primary key other than tablename_pkey.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: There is no RTLD_GLOBAL on OpenBSD, says Alex Pilosov <alex@pilosoft.com>.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make inet/cidr << and <<= operators indexable. From Alex Pilosov <alex@pilosoft.com>.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing PG_SETMASK(&BlockSig) to SIGHUP_handler().

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Support fake root install, separate build dir, dependency tracking, our choice of compiler and flags, uninstall, and peculiar Python installation layouts for PyGreSql. Also install into site-packages now, as officially recommended. And pgdb.py is also installed now, used to be forgotten.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Since a missing pg_pwd file is a valid situation, don't print an error message in that case.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add support to lock manager for conditionally locking a lock (ie, return without waiting if we can't get the lock immediately). Not used yet, but will be needed for concurrent VACUUM.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unused include file for long-dead flavors of locking.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: It turns out that the relcache thinks it can distinguish different rules and triggers by OID. So, even though we have no cross-references in the system catalogs to pg_rewrite.oid or pg_trigger.oid, we'd better have unique indexes on them. Put back pg_rewrite_oid_index, which I mistakenly removed a few days ago, and add pg_trigger_oid_index.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Oops, forgot to commit doco updates for has_table_privilege.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move export PGDATA to the proper place. Quote some variable substitutions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch removes some old and dead code (and some related misleading comments) from the PG_Stream class. Anders Bengtsson

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to remove the ConnectionHook functionality and thus the JDK 1.3 dependency. For a further explanation see my posting to the JDBC list on Friday, explaining why this is being done. Barry Lind

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Optimizer can now estimate selectivity of IS NULL, IS NOT NULL, IS TRUE, etc, with some degree of verisimilitude. Split out selectivity support functions from builtins.h into a new header file selfuncs.h, so as to reduce the number of header files builtins.h must depend on. Fix a few missing inclusions exposed thereby. From Joe Conway, with some kibitzing from Tom Lane.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out BYTEA binary compatibility changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Tweak startup sequence so that running out of PROC array slots is detected sooner in backend startup, and is treated as an expected error (it gives 'Sorry, too many clients already' now). This allows us not to have to enforce the MaxBackends limit exactly in the postmaster. Also, remove ProcRemove() and fold its functionality into ProcKill(). There's no good reason for a backend not to be responsible for removing its PROC entry, and there are lots of good reasons for the postmaster not to be touching shared-memory data structures.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Implement DatabaseMetaData.getCatalogs()

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't assume that max offset number stays fixed on a page when we're not holding a pin on the page. Use double instead of long to count rows in relation, so that code still works for > LONG_MAX rows in rel.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Under new theory of operation wherein postmaster forks children immediately, we will fork a child even if the database state does not permit connections to be accepted (eg, we are in recovery mode). The child process will correctly reject the connection and exit as soon as it's finished collecting the connection request message. However, this means that reaper() must be prepared to see child process exit signals even while it's waiting for startup or shutdown process to finish. As was, a connection request arriving during a database recovery or shutdown would cause postmaster abort.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: gcc did not like new pg_stat macros, for good and sufficient reason. Add 'do { ... } while (0)' decoration to eliminate compiler warnings.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous GUC variable references from commandline-GUC patch.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Handle Procedure calls. Now the version is 7.01.0006.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a patch to deal with the ones that I missed the first time around. I tested this patch under Cygwin and Linux. Note that I only changed dblink's Makefile in the most minimal way to fix the link problem under Cygwin (i.e., use the link rule from Makefile.shlib instead). dblink's Makefile should probably be further patched to be consistent with the other PostgreSQL Makefiles. Jason Tishler

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out SET ALL patch because it is breaking things.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here's a small patch for dblink: - fixed dblink invalid pointer causing corrupt elog message - fixed dblink_tok improper handling of null results - fixed examples in README.dblink Joe Conway

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Keep the list of to-be-NOTIFYed names in a plain List palloc'd in TopTransactionContext, rather than using Dllist. This simplifies and speeds up the code, and eliminates a former risk of coredump when out of memory (since the old code didn't bother to check for malloc failure). It also moves us one step closer to retiring Dllist...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove grammar restrictions on order of optional clauses in CREATE GROUP. From Vince Vielhaber.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Create a new HeapTupleSatisfiesVacuum() routine in tqual.c that embodies the validity checking rules for VACUUM. Make some other rearrangements of the VACUUM code to allow more code to be shared between full and lazy VACUUM. Minor code cleanups and added comments for TransactionId manipulations.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessarily enthusiastic parenthesizing in reverse-listing of IS NULL, IS TRUE, and friends (my fault...)

Document.author: petere
Document.document: postgresql.badint property name was probably meant to be postgresql.res.badint, since that's the name in the properties file.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Sync with jdbc2, remove gratuitous white space differences.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove ConnectionHook.java. No longer used, bad code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a little more error checking and reporting to readDatum().

Document.author: darcy
Document.document: Make sure that everything says version 3.2.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add GUC setting for Australian timezones. Uses new GUC boolean callback functions to clear date cache. Allow regression tests to pass when timezone set.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve wording of authentication files.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out SET AUTHORIZATION patch until security is resolved.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add win32 c++ files.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Added GUC configuration options to control access statistics. Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First non-stub implementation of shared free space map. It's not super useful as yet, since its primary source of information is (full) VACUUM, which makes a concerted effort to get rid of free space before telling the map about it ... next stop is concurrent VACUUM ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Further work on connecting the free space map (which is still just a stub) into the rest of the system. Adopt a cleaner approach to preventing deadlock in concurrent heap_updates: allow RelationGetBufferForTuple to select any page of the rel, and put the onus on it to lock both buffers in a consistent order. Remove no-longer-needed isExtend hack from API of ReleaseAndReadBuffer.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add IS UNKNOWN, IS NOT UNKNOWN boolean tests, fix the existing boolean tests to return the correct results per SQL9x when given NULL inputs. Reimplement these tests as well as IS [NOT] NULL to have their own expression node types, instead of depending on special functions. From Joe Conway, with a little help from Tom Lane.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow removal of system-named pg_* temp tables. Rename temp file/dir as pgsql_tmp.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove mention that PREPARE is not implemented.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove formatter's assumption that year would never exceed four digits. Enforce MAXTZLEN for all datestyles, not just some. Remove macro definitions that were redundant with datetime.h.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: German message localization for JDBC

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Repair libpq to follow protocol by not sending Terminate messages before the startup exchange is complete. Also make sure that packets defined as single bytes aren't sent with a trailing 'BACKSLASH0'.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a couple remaining places where GUC variables were assigned to directly, rather than through SetConfigOption().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a couple remaining places where GUC variables were assigned to directly, rather than through SetConfigOption().

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Don't use a temp file. It was created insecurely and was easy to do without.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: -Bsymbolic requires -lc on NetBSD. Also add rpath for non-ELF. from Johnny C. Lam <lamj@stat.cmu.edu> via D'Arcy

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up some longstanding problems in shared-cache invalidation. SI messages now include the relevant database OID, so that operations in one database do not cause useless cache flushes in backends attached to other databases. Declare SI messages properly using a union, to eliminate the former assumption that Oid is the same size as int or Index. Rewrite the nearly-unreadable code in inval.c, and document it better. Arrange for catcache flushes at end of command/transaction to happen before relcache flushes do --- this avoids loading a new tuple into the catcache while setting up new relcache entry, only to have it be flushed again immediately.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Corrected the check for *message truncated* for the future use.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make code malloc memory of proper length.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Better document use of ident on localhost, per Tom Lane's idea.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement LockBufferForCleanup(), which will allow concurrent VACUUM to wait until it's safe to remove tuples and compact free space in a shared buffer page. Miscellaneous small code cleanups in bufmgr, too.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix typo. createdb -t --> createdb -T

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix typo. createdb -t --> createdb -T

Document.author: petere
Document.document: portability enhancements

Document.author: petere
Document.document: National language support for pg_dump and pg_restore. Combined with big message clean up.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove another unused include file with obsolete, useless, confusing definitions in it.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Handle reading of startup packet and authentication exchange after forking a new postmaster child process. This should eliminate problems with authentication blocking (e.g., ident, SSL init) and also reduce problems with the accept queue filling up under heavy load. The option to send elog output to a different file per backend (postgres -o) has been disabled for now because the initialization would have to happen in a different order and it's not clear we want to keep this anyway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing encode file.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > > Put encode() into base system. Used part of Alex' patch > > for docs, hope he does not mind SEMICOLON) Marko Kreen

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix duplication of -D during pg_ctl restart, from Peter E's patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add SHARE UPDATE EXCLUSIVE lock mode, coming soon to a VACUUM near you. Name chosen per pghackers discussion around 6/22/01.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to replication.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: More message munging and localization for pg_dump, especially the --verbose messages, which had not been considered so far. Output to the terminal should okay nowSEMICOLON comments written into the dump are still English only, which may or may not be the desirable thing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In any case, it seems the REL7_1 branch needs the update too...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add missing dependency and fix thinko.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add replication email.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Marko Kreen <marko@l-t.ee> writes: > > secure_ctx changes too. it will be PGC_BACKEND after '-p'. > > Oh, okay, I missed that part. Could we see the total state of the > patch --- ie, a diff against current CVS, not a bunch of deltas? > I've gotten confused about what's in and what's out. Ok, here it is. Cleared the ctx comment too - after -p it will be PGC_BACKEND in any case. Marko Kreen

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add prototypes to supress warnings.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove direct calls of index_insert(), instead use ExecInsertIndexTuples(). This makes VACUUM work properly with partial indexes, and avoids memory leakage with functional indexes. Also, suppress complaint about fewer index tuples than heap tuples when the index is a partial index. From Martijn van Oosterhout.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Bring DatabaseMetaData feature tests up to date: * NULLs are sorted differently in 7.2 * table correlation names are supported * GROUP BY, ORDER BY unrelated is supported since 6.4 * ESCAPE/LIKE only supported since 7.1 * outer joins only since 7.1 * preferred term for procedure is "function" * preferred term for catalog is "database" * supports SELECT for UPDATE since 6.5 * supports subqueries * supports UNIONSEMICOLON supports UNION ALL since 7.1 * update some of the max lengths to match reality * rearrange some functions to match the order in the spec for easier maintenance

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair logic error for multi-key indexes. From Oleg Bartunov.
